messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 5256
messages.msgSnippet: ... each line of the song, you get four weeks, so the whole song is a month long.
messages.messageBody:
Sandra wrote:

>>>>Oh! The tune is "Yankee Doodle," so if you sing the days of the week
>>>>to
each line of the song, you get four 'weeks,' so the whole song is a month
long.
<g> <<<<

Thank you!!! Years ago, when I was first married and only 19, I taught
kindrgarten at an unaccredited Christian school in CA. I had absolutely no
guidance from the principal or other teachers, so I did everything my own
way, making it up as I went along. One of the things I did was make up
songs to help the children (I had 13 in the group) learn things like days of
the week or months of the year. I usually just used familiar tunes because
I'm only semi-musical (love it but not talented).

I never realized what tune I (almost )used for days of the week until now!
(A few notes are off, but very similar). But I only sing it through two
times, like a verse. I love it with the chorus included.

Brenda Rose
